message: Just wanted to let more people know that SimplePastie is probably the easiest gist client for OS X. http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/simplepastie/id402351865?mt=12. Does anyone know of any others?
if they have github gist and they need to add pastebin
i just use the GitHub bundle for Textmate. select what you want to gist, two keyboard shortcuts later and it's copied into your clipboard. https://github.com/drnic/github-tmbundle
Really like the idea, but it clobbers ⌘⇧V (normally paste as plain text or paste and match style) with it's global keybindings.
Huh, didn't know textmate did that. Is there a similar plugin for vim?
@Daryl I use https://github.com/mattn/gist-vim for creating gists from vim. works great.
Anyone know if there's something available for Sublime?
@samjiman Haven't used it, but https://github.com/bgreenlee/sublime-github looks promising. See also Package Control, as this is in its repository list by default
I just created quickhubapp which also supports gists creation (and more to come), you can check it at http://quickhubapp.com
